website_summaries.verdict: Designed for bigger dogs that pull, this leash prioritizes securing a harder-to-wield animal.
pros: Take your larger dog for an extended run without wearing out your arms trying to keep her in check
It has a superior design that spreads out the tension, leading to a more comfortable experience
Can switch to a hands-on leash easily in high-stress situations like crossing a busy street
cons: The waistband can be uncomfortable for smaller people

customer_reviews.title: Versatile AF!
customer_reviews.text: Love this hands free leash! We’ve used it mostly hiking and it’s been great! The extra stretch of the bungee leash feels more comfortable for both my dog and myself. I really love the 2 handles on the leash so I can pull her closer when passing people on the trail. It all seems strong and well made, which is what I need for my dog (she’s 105lbs). It adjusts nicely so my husband and I can switch off. It’s so nice to be hands free bc on certain hikes, I like to use trekking poles. A lot of people hate leashing their dogs for hiking but there are rules we need to follow and this leash will help.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Remirez

customer_reviews.title: Great for those with Arthritis.
customer_reviews.text: Love this leash and it’s versatility. I have arthritis in my hands and my beagle got loose last year. She was gone for 4 days. Having this leash I feel more confident walking her. She’s a puppy mill rescue with a lot of fears so she can be difficult to walk. Being that it’s hands free I can also take her places like the Farmers Market to shop and. It have to juggle the lead.
customer_reviews.author: Heather N.

customer_reviews.title: The bungee part of the leash broke within months!
customer_reviews.text: How long is it supposed to last? I would've hope it would last for at least a year. I bought this late January for my 39lb dog, overall it was a fair design. For us the bungee absorbed minimal tension from him pulling but it was still super neat to walk/ jog him hands free. Everything was great until it the bungee cord broke today while jogging with him, I honestly would've thought the clasp would've break first. I walk/ jog him with this about 2-3 times a week about 30 minute each time so it has been used at most 30 times before it broke. Needless to say I'm really disappointed at the quality of it.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy C.

customer_reviews.title: Broken bunjee
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this for a few months now and the bunjee inside just broke with very little resistance. I’m very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: adam a

customer_reviews.title: Great dog leash for walking and running!
customer_reviews.text: This leash is perfect for walking my dog because it has a reflective coating so it’s safe to use at night! I like that I have the option to use it around my waist to go running with my dog but unfortunately I haven’t been able to use it for that purpose because of a knee injury. The leash is durable, although it’s starting to fray because my dog chewed on it but it seems to be holding up just fine. I love the blue color also!
customer_reviews.author: MerrY RevieWer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good design
customer_reviews.text: This leash had many flaws: 1. The strap that goes around your body is narrow, so if your dog pulls, the strap digs deeply into your back. It is really uncomfortable. 2. The material of the waist strap is very slick. It runs back and forth and slides up and down. No matter where you want it to ride, it won't stay in place. 3. The loops are in awkward locations. Unless your dog is tall (lab size) you will have to bend over to use the loop near the dog. 4. The leash is NOT reflective. And 5. The bungee really doesn't give.
customer_reviews.author: Noneofyour

customer_reviews.title: Awesome until it was damaged
customer_reviews.text: The bungee is very nice, it helped to relieve my back pain. After using the leash for one month, my Siberian Husky pulled suddenly and teared apart the leash. The bungee was detached from both sides. If your dog pulls hard, I think this is not the right leash. I liked the product very much until it worked. I was planning to use two leashes in parallel to prevent a future damage, but I found another leash with three bungees attached serially. I think that the three bungee leash will perform better.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Cendales

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Runners and their Dog
customer_reviews.text: Immediately you will notice that this is a high quality product. When you look closely, you will see that it was designed from experimentation: running with a dog. If you are considering switching from a leash to this product, have to fear. Jump right in. You won't regret it. I intend to buy a second one as a gift for my daughter and her dog. Now she's a real runner; 10ks and full marathons.
customer_reviews.author: Consultant Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Update: the company contacted me directly after my initial review and they have refunded the purchase price and they are sending me a new leash. Their customer service is amazing! At first I loved this leash and would have given it 5 stars for everything, but after a month of use the elastic snapped inside and now it’s too long and drags on the ground. I really liked the concept of this leash and still enjoy the hands-free aspect, but because of the broken elastic I have to be more hands on than I intended. The actual leash is sturdy and does a fine job.
customer_reviews.author: Robin M. Dadzie

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, the bungee is great for me and my dog.
customer_reviews.text: This leash is extremely comfortable. We have huskies and live in the mountains. Our huskies often see rabbits and other wildlife and take off trying to get them. Having the waist strap gives us more comfort with the dogs as they are now pulling from our center of gravity and the bungee appears to be more comfortable for our dogs. The bungee gives them some warning that they nearing the end of their leash, as the traditional leash seemed to cause them discomfort when it would suddenly tighten. The bungee is more comfortable for us, but also for our wonderful dogs. I would definitely recommend this leash.
customer_reviews.author: RandomUsername

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Leash - Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: Definitely an improvement over holding the leash while we run. My 45 pound mix is pretty good at not pulling, but the elastic is helpful in ensuring that she (and I) don't get hurt. The belt adjusts to size fairly easily, and the handle for the least is nice if you want to detach from the belt and just walk normally after a run. Cons - Poop bag canister slaps your legs when running (I replaced it with a soft pouch) - Elastic cord is slightly too long. Takes some getting used to in order to control how far your dog can lunge from you.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Mccahill

customer_reviews.title: One of my better leashes, buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this leash for my Greyhound, after having used the smaller bungee with my Beagle and seeing how much easier it was on my arm when he constantly pulled. My Greyhound is much better trained and hardly pulls but I wanted this leash because of its versatility and having two handles helps especially when I need to go short leash to control her when she gets excited seeing squirrels. The pouch with the two D rings on each side is also great when I take both my dogs out together for a walk I can attach one leash to the ring and have one of my hands free. I highly recommend this leash.
customer_reviews.author: nucrph

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and way too big
customer_reviews.text: I wear 32 inch waist pants with a belt and can't tighten this thing enough to stay around my waist while moving. I can't imagine anyone with less than a 40 inch waist being able to run without tripping themselves. I had to feed it through the belt loops in my pants to keep it on and it was cumbersome. Seems very sturdy, which also makes it very heavy for what it is. Not good for hikers/backpackers who are looking to keep things light and bring their dog along unless your dog is huge and undisciplined on a leash. I'm going to have to improvise on today's hike and use paracord for the belt.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love it, but it broke before I could use it for two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this two stars because I REALLY loved it the first week and a half I used it. BUT it broke at the handle. This was exactly what I was looking for when it came to hands free leash for running, but every once in a while, you do need to hold onto the handle itself redirect your dog to avoid running off the trail, or into a stream, etc. Well... the leash handle snapped apart on me mid run. If the product can’t stand before even two weeks has passed, well it’s simply not effective. I REALLY wanted to love it, but I just can’t love something that breaks so easily.
customer_reviews.author: TeriLynn Rao

customer_reviews.title: Bungees in leash give way under siege continued strain
customer_reviews.text: The leash will not break and your dog will not get away from you. the elastic in the leash will give way if your dog pulls too much and too often. As a point of reference, we have a 50 lb hound that cannot help but pull when it smells a fox or a cat. The elastics gave away after about two months near daily usage. The waist belt is great for running and hands-free dog walking. without the elastic you do need to be concerned about a large dog pulling you over with the waist belt on. Fortunately I'm handy and I pulled out upholstery thread and I have resewn the elastics in.
customer_reviews.author: Concious Consumer

customer_reviews.title: I will definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: This hands free leash is a life changer. I don't know I didn't try it before! It is a life saver for my shoulder and the waistband is so easy to adjust! My Husky loves to pull a lot and the bungee helped to control him better. Now I can walk and even run with him without beeing pulled each time he sees something interesting. Thanks to this hands free leash I can say that I love to get out with my dog once again! Thank you SparlyPets for such a great product! I will definetely recommend it to my friends or anyone who asks me about the leash!
customer_reviews.author: ClaUS

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a while back but only recently started using this to jog with my dog. It’s a bit in the heavy side but overall seemed like a good product . Today (fourth time using) the zipper To the pouch fell off because it wasn’t sewn in to the seam... so that defeats on of the main reasons Of getting this. Unfortunately for me it’s too late to return or exchange since I bought this a while back so the least I can do is share my experience with others thinking about purchasing this product
customer_reviews.author: Jenderland

customer_reviews.title: Nicest leash I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.text: It is so much better in person than I was expecting. It’s looks very high end and well made. I got the black and teal blue one. It’s ideal for me because I have severe rheumatoid arthritis, neuropathy and at times holding onto a leash isn’t possible for long without hand numbness or pain. This allows me to have my dog secure and hands free unless I need to get him in closer to me while someone is passing by or to load him into the car. I love the pouch. Very handy for my phone (iPhone X), dog baggies and still extra room for a few small things if you needed them. 10/10 would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Solves three problems very well!
customer_reviews.text: You may have noticed this belt has rings on both sides of the buckle. My guess that it would make it resist breaking the buckle, or pulling it open seems valid. The leash is strong. and has a tough covering. You'd think that would be a given, but, sadly, I have bought a couple of leashes that were very weak, and my dogs have already permanently stretched them out! The little pouch is a nice touch. Every had people staring at you, and you realize you forgot your bags? It's just better to have a roll of bags stashed in the pouch! Really, for the price I wasn't expecting anything even close to this good!
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Scott Macmillan

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for the product received
customer_reviews.text: The “little” bag that comes with this is just that, very little. I can put treats in it, but it does NOT fit a small phone or really anything else. Overall I was very disappointed. I don’t know what the bungee thought is but it’s a useless one. This is also for a trained dog that doesn’t pull, my one year old puppy is going to need a bit more training before I can hook him to my waist. I put it right back in the box and wanted to return it, but I’m terrible at that so I just have this kind of expensive leash in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Leila Lineberger

customer_reviews.title: Safe running with my huskey
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item after reading other reviews that had positive information about using this with their huskies. Ours is a one-year-old and she has a ton of innate huskiness. Meaning she loves to pull. The setup keeps the pressure in the middle of your body and allows your the center of your mass to balance the pulling. I find myself without a sore arm due to the constant pulling as well. Now my dog enjoys her pulling and I am not feeling like a strung-out accordion after our ten-mile run. The quality of the leash and clasps is good and feels like it should last me quite a few years.
customer_reviews.author: James Bergh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome handsfree sturdy leash
customer_reviews.text: Love this leash. I have a 30lb active dog that sometimes is a little dog reactive on leash. I got this leash and it feels better sturdy and strong. It says it's meant for larger dogs but my dog is a strong little dog so I wanted to make sure she will be safe if she pulls so she doesn't break it. I attach my smaller 10 lb dog on one of the other rings with a clip ( separate) and it works awesome for walking them hands free. I like the springy part on the leash and that u can detach it easily and use it as a regular leash if needed.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great running leash!
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely awesome running leash. I run about 150 miles a month and my dog tags along for about half of that each month. I started using this leash about 2 weeks ago and it is SO much better than the last one I was using. It has a bungee cord in the middle that keeps it tight when my dog is near me but lets her stretch it out to get a few feet away. I am also not being nearly pulled off my feet each time she stops to sniff something since it has a bit of give to it due to the bungee cord.
customer_reviews.author: Myron TTop Contributor: Lego

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Leash!!! (But a tad long for us short girls!)
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid set-up for running with my large labrador. There is plenty of give in the leash itself, but not really a shortcut for shortening the leash length. I'm 5'2, so the lease hangs a little lower than I would normally like, but that was by no means a deal breaker! I run with my dog at my left leg and this leash is super convenient-- I just tied a couple of knots in it to take some of the slack out. Would definitely recommend this leash to any runner with a well-behaved dog!
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Use this more than a regular leash now.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for running and fast walking. Thinking that this leash would only be used for that purpose. I now prefer this over a regular leash. My hands are free and it's so much better. We have a husky and he pulls to do everything when we are on our walks/runs. Now I also can pull on him when I want to stop or go in another direction. He has caught on to this and we have an understanding now, HA. The bungee helps relived the stress on the pulling as well. I just wish there was an option to buy two different belts since the people who walk the dog have different waist sizes.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Great for potty training puppies!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hands-free leash for the puppy we just got. I love it. The least itself is very sturdy, and the belt isn’t uncomfortable. You can use the leash without the belt as well. I have used it for taking him into the backyard to go potty so he doesn’t have too much freedom (recommended for potty training puppies). I would definitely recommend this product to anyone training a puppy, or for the freedom to have your dog with you without having to use your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Wyler

customer_reviews.title: Helps keep dog under control
customer_reviews.text: Using it with my high anxiety and hyperactive 50 lb dog. I am a hefty 72 yr old female, and the belt part fit me perfectly. With one end of the leash portion clipped to the 2 D rings in the front and the other end to my dog’s harness it is a secure connection. I do hold the leash lightly closer to me for any needed quick corrections. This item is sturdy, the slightly stretchy leash absorbs shock if my dog lunges. Wish this item had been available long ago. 😀
customer_reviews.author: LeonaBelle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Durable
customer_reviews.text: We have had this leash for two years now. It still looks fabulous. No fraying or pulled stitching. Our girl is a large mix breed, who is excellently leash trained (the leash is always just slightly slack when she’s walking, she never pulls). BUT she (understandably) loves to take off after the occasional rabbit with no warning. This leash has saved my husband’s arms from being ripped out of their sockets. I love to use the belt, as I have more control over the dog when I can use more weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made, great product!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Great product! I read reviews that it broke quickly or the bungee gave out; I don’t see how. I walk dogs and tested it first by tying it to a pole and jerked tugged pulled with everything I had (5’10” 160lbs and I’m strong), then with a 95lb dog that likes to pull and this leash isn’t going to break. But always test first Incase there is a flaw. I wore the belt on bare skin and it was fine. I love the two handles and different rings to clip bags etc, even another dog. GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great Hands Free Leash
customer_reviews.text: I love the bungee feel of the leash. My dog will pull a little but recognizes the pull of the bungee as his boundary. The leash is a little longer than I’m used to but short enough I don’t worry about my dog running into the street when I’m walking on the sidewalk. Most importantly I can shorten the waist band enough that it doesn’t slide down when I am running. I would definitely recommend this leash to anyone that wants a hands free leash for walking or running with their dog. Works great for my Husky mix.
customer_reviews.author: M. Moran

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this hands-free dog leash. It is fantastic. I used it this evening to walk the dog and push the baby in the stroller and I feel like I just did a hundred sit-ups. With the strap being around your waist you're using your stomach muscles when the dog is pulling. I think I might lose some inches off my waist by using this so it's another bonus. I had no issues adjusting the waistband and the leash part was long enough. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great for running with my golden.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use when running with my golden running partner, rather than use a flexi leash and not be able to move my hands. I tried another brand but it was way to stiff and too tight. Tried this one since it has more give to the bungee leash as my golden pulls, but not to hard. This works perfectly. When he does pull, it stretches just right. The waste belt stays tight and doesn't loosen up while running. The only negative is that is could be about a foot longer. I solved that by adding a short section of cord. Using a harness and this leash makes for great running.
customer_reviews.author: kidfrcleve

customer_reviews.title: Strong and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I took my dogs for a walk last night and used this for my dachshund. She is perfect on leash and does not pull allowing my hands to be free to handle my doberman and focus on her training. It is a game-changer! I can now load and buckle the big dog and not worry about her getting loose. It is definitely a comfortable experience also. I’m likely to never put my big dog on it, but in a pinch, she could be connected to it also. This will be my go to for our walks.
customer_reviews.author: PlynnebTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for medium size dogs
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my medium size Plott hound Shepard who weighs about 50lbs. Great for our long walks where I don’t have to consistently hold the leash for 1.5 hours or when when we go for a job/run. I like how there’s a part to buckle that he can move about 180 degrees around you. The additional tension helps since he isn’t fighting me as much as he fights the tension when trying to chase after a bird or squirrel. The handle could be better
customer_reviews.author: Spatel133

customer_reviews.title: The perfect product for being active with you dog safely leashed
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect product for what I was looking for. It allpws me and my dog to go for runs while having her leashed but not inhibiting my ability to run comfortably. The bungee leash is perfect for letting her know if she's either pulling ahead or falling behind and the times she does decide to stop it lets me know before any serious impact/tugging can happen. I highly recommend this product not only on here but I also have to everyone on my social media, this is a really great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer T

customer_reviews.title: YES!! get it!
customer_reviews.text: i have a 13lbs dog. the leash is on a heavier side. definitely better would work better for medium and larger dogs. but and it works really well my dog just isn’t strong enough to actually stretch the bungee leash. lol i love that it’s hard free. i don’t have to worry so much about losing her. i’d never use another leash again ever. perfect way to walk your dog. and i love the rings. i can hang my keys, water bowl and poop bags.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: very heavy and clunky- does not fit the description at all
customer_reviews.text: looks nice enough but not at all effecient- it is very heavy not easy to adjust- I have to check amazon how to do it ... makes no sense - I'd return it if I could. I am pretty strong and really do not like the heavy and clunkiness of this leash- my dog is scared by it ( granted she scares easier- but her leash is a first!) the bunny cord is not very absorbing ( my other leash much better- and lighter) consider all this when buying it. I'd return it if I could
customer_reviews.author: h dekker

customer_reviews.title: Great for running, for both me and my pup
customer_reviews.text: I like running. My dog likes running. But she also sometimes likes to go off on sudden sprints and I don't like having my leash arm getting pulled out of its socket. This leash is great for giving me my running form back when I take my dog on our jogs. Added bonus that the color matched the pictures online, which matches my dog's harness. PROS: - sturdy material, - reflective, good for evening/early morning - give and resistance CONS: - Haven't really needed the leash bag, but I have a rack for my dog's leashes. Honestly can't complain for getting more than I needed. Overall, great product and great pricing, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Has made dog walking much easier!
customer_reviews.text: This belt and leash combo work so well and have made walking 2 dogs so much easier! Being a little clumsy and having dogs with different leash-walking abilities, I would often find myself tangled and/or dropping a leash. With one pup hooked to this belt and the other on a traditional leash, I find myself less tangled overall. My dogs are small but it is sturdy and I would feel comfortable using this with a large dog (but I cannot speak to how well it would withstand constant pulling).
customer_reviews.author: JBae

customer_reviews.title: Great leash for adventurous pups!
customer_reviews.text: We love this leash! We have an adventurous puppy who is now 10months and 65 pounds and the hands free feature and extra give that the bungee part of the leash had allows me to take her on long hikes in the woods without any shoulder pain. I plan to run with this when she’s old enough, but highly recommend to anyone with a pup who pulls a little more than you’d like. You still have full control with the two different grab handles, but it takes the pressure off everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Bungee snapped
customer_reviews.text: To start off I will say the construction seemed to be very solid. The webbing material is much more durable than other leashes I have used. The failure happened with the bungee cord that runs inside the leash. After about a month I could feel the bungee cord had mostly torn away and this week it finally snapped. If the bungee material had been sewn in better/or had a better attachment point I would be giving this product 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: JDKansas

customer_reviews.title: I chose this leash over other leashes like it because where you hook the leash into the ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog is older and stays close. Also she doesn't "pull". I find this leash very simple to use and convenient. I chose this leash over other leashes like it because where you hook the leash into the belt it requires you to hook onto both sides of the belt. There's no chance of the belt unlatching. I find comfort in that as most belts are latched with plastic that can easily be broken or pulled apart (i.e. If your dog is a puller, it can happen with other leashes). I just wish pink was an option.
customer_reviews.author: Sim

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price. A good alternative to the expensive one.
customer_reviews.text: As both the dog walker and someone who has my own dogs, I tried this product out because it was a cheaper option to the leading brand. I have used the other brand at client's houses, and it is definitely a higher quality. But this one stands up pretty well. Definitely worth the money and guess the job done. I would imagine it might not stand up to a hundred plus pound dog, but I've used it for an 80 lb dog who pulls like a monster before.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Love it but the leash is too long
customer_reviews.text: I gave it four stars because the leash length is more of personal preference and definitely depends on your height. Since I am slightly vertically challenged (5' 3") the leash is far too long. I use this for running with my shepherd. The leash is so long that he forgets it's even there and starts to slowly run a little faster than my pace. I have to tell him to heal every ten minutes or so. I tied three knots in the leash and the length is now perfect. It is great for hiking in areas where a leash is required. I love the color, design and that the leash is kinda stretchy.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Mota

customer_reviews.title: awesome for jogging with your dog
customer_reviews.text: I use this to jog with my German Shepherd. It's well made, sturdy and fits my needs. I was running with just a regular leash which was messing with my form and getting me jerked around. With this leash I can focus on my running form, if my dog strays the bungee catches her, I don't feel any pull or jerk. It also has 2 handles along the leash if I need to pull her in closer. Love, Love, Love this leash.
customer_reviews.author: Laura R.

customer_reviews.title: It does what it needs to do, but there are flaws.
customer_reviews.text: I really love this product it does just what it says providing hands-free dog walking. The belt fits me (women's L-XL) and adjusted quickly to fit my friend (women's S-M) the bungee is nice and really does it's job well (I have a very active Siberian husky) Cons: built in handles are useless and take too long to get open for them to be useful. Also, the hooks are just the basic hook, could really benefit from sturdier hooks on both ends as one of them is already broken (2 months old when it broke)
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: This leash is GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: When she isn't in heel my dog likes to go back and forth, I like to position the slider so she can be in front of me on either side and it works REALLY well. The bungee is strong but gives enough that minor things don't trip us up! Highly recommended if you are thinking about one of these leashes, this is the best one I have tried. Very comfortable and the slider helps with preventing rope burn from a spinning waist band. (Or if you like you can use the stationary clip, nice to have the flexibility!)
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Problem with the elastic?
customer_reviews.text: This has been great for running our Husky. However it didn't last a year. I bought it in March and it just failed on me this week. All of the elastic has gone out of the leash so the extra slack leaves it dragging and getting caught up around my dogs legs. I am having to constantly having to stop my run to untangle. It was awesome while it lasted I just wish it would have lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great to be hands free
customer_reviews.text: This is my everyday leash I use when I walk my dog. It holds up pretty nicely, had it for a few months now. any recommendation don't wear it when it's raining or has rained out before your walk. Otherwise the dog can take you for a ride ask me how I know that? Long time I use a different leash that's why I'm taking him to event when I use a shorter leash just to keep him under control. but you're going somewhere where the dog can have freedom it's the one to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kalib

customer_reviews.title: Better than the other 3 I owned before
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been the sturdiest hands free bungee that we bought. I already bought 3 other ones and since I have big dogs, most of the buckles and clasps break. We use it daily so there's a lot of Wear and tear. I hope this one really lasts longer than my others. So far so good. Looks like it's good quality and there's even a bag where you can put it in. Where you clasp your lead slides so it adds to the flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: Bani

customer_reviews.title: It didn't fit around my waist, it was way ...
customer_reviews.text: It didn't fit around my waist, it was way too big and didn't stay up on my hips. I am 5'3 and 130 pounds, so about average.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin OPry

customer_reviews.title: May work with small dogs but NOT suitable for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: We just bought this for our 90 pound high-energy dog. The leash poses serious safety issues. When a large dog pulls on the bungee, it creates a "whiplash" affect which can snap the leash out of your hand. The bungee snaps back and the metal clip on the end becomes a projectile, possibly hitting you or your dog. This happened to my wife after one use and the metal clip hit and cut her wrist. Seemed like a nice idea... but dangerous for use with large dogs.
customer_reviews.author: LoveGear63

customer_reviews.title: Great too for letting a dog feel offlead or for training a newer pup
customer_reviews.text: This is great for running with my greyhound, who heels without reminder, and also a wonderful tool for my newer hound who is still in training. I hook this lead to their harness, and if we are still working on commands etc I also connect a training lead to their collar. That way I can feel secure that they are safely attached at two points and I only correct with the collar lead as necessary. The only reason I gave 4 stars and not 5 is that the hardware closures seem loose and small--I plan on using an additional clip to add some security where the lead attaches to the dogs harness or collar.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie Hretz

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 83 pound greyhound who can be a handful at times. I also have very good bungee type leashes 4', 5' and 6' which serve me well. I was ecstatic finally using this leash set-up today. It worked flawlessly. I also am almost a full-time RVer and wanted it for our outings. I am buying another one to keep in the RV. It is always easier to have duplicates ready to go instead of forgetting things.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bachman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a lab/golden retriever mix. She is big and her walks are not so easy since she is so excited to walk. This leash allows me to walk in the street giving her liberty to move around me and explore without tugging in me. She has broken many leashes and this seems to be strong. It does have area for her to tug like a bunjy cord. I love it, and it is the prwfered leash I use to walk her.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy...& heavy
customer_reviews.text: I bought the leash in anticipation of my puppy growing -Big! And although I like the leash and it's durable; I have to wait a few more months for my puppy to "grow into it." Reason: the leash is heavy (not a bad thing if you have a med-big solid dog). My dog will eventually get there, so it WILL get used. It's a great quality, no problems item. Only CON: I would've liked for it to stretch and retract more (like the retractable leashes). But then, that's not the reason I bought this leash. If I could give a 4.5, I would and only because of the rigidness in the leash. However, it is a GREAT buy overall!
customer_reviews.author: Trynity

customer_reviews.title: Safe Leash Husband's Obsessed
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this to walk our 10 mo old wheaten terrier who pulls. We wanted something to be able to better control him and something that had some shock absorption so he wouldn't hurt himself. Strong strap and good length. My husband enjoys the hands free aspect. We just took our pup to an animal shelter fundraiser at a brewery and he was able to have our pup join us on the leash while having a beer in his hand and mingling with other pups and owners. Definitely recommend! I am pregnant so have not been able to use yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Happy dog and happy owner
customer_reviews.text: I have a 65 pound golden doodle that loves to jog with me. She also can’t help but try to chase a squirrel when she sees one. The spring in this leash is just right to prevent either of us getting yanked too hard when a squirrel sighting occurs. With my old leash, she would nearly yank my arm off. It’s also really nice to have both hands back while jogging. The initial quality is solid. Strong loops, good sewing, easy adjustments, good spring, and no trouble handling my large 4-legged friend. The loop is easy to grab if you need to help navigate the dog or pull her in tight (person passing, turning a tight corner, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: J. DeMent

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, Quality Hands-Free Leash
customer_reviews.text: I have a medium sized dog to who loves to pull. I use an easy walk harness that attaches in the front which helps keep her from pulling too much, but she still does it. I purchased this to use when walking/jogging with her and the bungee feature is fantastic. She can pull, but because of the bungee it isn't as forceful and is easier to manage. I really love the minimalist color scheme of black/grey and enjoy that the leash part can be used as a regular leash as well. I would recommend this to anyone who is even remotely interested in purchasing a hands-free leash like this one.
customer_reviews.author: D. Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Good control
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I have a 10 month old German Shepard that hasn’t really gotten going for walks down yet but this really helps to keep him from being able to pull away. He likes to run after small animals and this really prevents him from being able to take off. The only thing that would make it better was if it was a little longer but that doesn’t take away from how well it works. If you have a really strong, impulsive dog this will help 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Couch

customer_reviews.title: Amazing hands free leash!!!
customer_reviews.text: This leash is incredible! I love the hands free aspect of it so I can carry trash to the dumpster or have free hands for texting. My dog is a puller and the bungee of this leash slows her to pull just a little but then yanks her back, so my dog gets mad at the leash but that makes me love it more! I feel so secure that my dog will not run away and I even sent this leash to my sister who just got a dog!
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Best leash out there
customer_reviews.text: So far this product has been exactly what we have been looking for in a hands-free leash. The materials and construction are incredibly durable AND it has reflective stripes which is ideal for evening walks!!! The hands free designs has been perfect for giving rewards while on the go!!! I’ve had this leash for weeks and my pup has put it through the ringer, and it still looks and feels brand new!
customer_reviews.author: Okpk

customer_reviews.title: Helps with pulling
customer_reviews.text: I bought this handsfree leash because, honestly, I'm tired of my dog pulling on my arm. I tried it out on my 60lb, 10year old huskey/pit mix. She pulled at first but quickly settled into a loose leash walk. The only problem I encountered was she likes to walk right in front of me which would cause me to step on the back of her feet (right on her heels). Near the end of the walk I started correcting her by pulling her lead back over to the side. Hopefully by the next few walks this will keep her from walking in front of me. Also I will update when I try this on my 16lb dachshund.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Excellent jogging leash
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product thinking it may be one of the most brilliant jogging leashes made or the dog will end up dragging my unconscious body down the street. The leash design works very well. The bungee provides enough give to allow my dog to run a little ahead of me without the feeling of being dragged or pulled off balance. Its just the right length so I don’t feel like I’m tripping on extra leash, nor does it trip up my dog. It’s well made with super sturdy material. I’m very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pro Hands Free Leash
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the leash! The multiple attachment points are perfect. I also think that the sliding attachment point in the center of the belt is genius! I have a Bull Terrier ( they can be stubborn) lol and I'm finding that using the center attachment point a little to my right with the lead coming behind me to Mudslide on the left puts him in a perfect heal position and th bungee action causes him to gently self correct if he tries to forge ahead. I absolutely love it and highly recommend.Thanks a mil for a wonderful product! Vickip
customer_reviews.author: Bracktoo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great leash and belt set up. I like that the leash clips onto the belt so you can take it off and use as a normal leash instead of it being a part of the belt. My other one the belt is attached to the leash, so I would have to take it off and readjust the length. Very comfortable. Leash is a little short, for my liking, but by no means takes away from how great this is. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Best Leash Combo I've Found! So Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well! I chose this one since there was a metal ring on each side to keep the belt from coming off. I have a very strong dog and also board bully breeds and larger dogs. With this leash I can walk three decently sized dogs without an issue. The bungee helps with controlling the excitement of them pulling to pee on tree or greet another dog. I highly recommend this leash in particular. Very good quality and has extra D-ring for poo bag or another leash depending on the situation.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea!!! Love the Hands Free
customer_reviews.text: I love how sturdy this product is, and the idea of being hands-free is great. I just adopted a 10-year-old pittie and she is 65 pounds of muscle. For some reason, she doesn't pull as much when I use this and I really like that I can also hold the leash handle for a second support. The bungie is great so that I feel her pull before she knocks me over! Much better handling and super cool clolors! Super Great.
customer_reviews.author: Jerri Mccombs

customer_reviews.title: Great hands free leash!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great leash. I was very happy with the waist belt that attach me and my dog, so now I can walk him or run with him hands free! It is very cold here currently and being able to keep my hands in my coat pockets is wonderful. My dog adjusted to the new leash immediately and I don't have to worry about him bolting and pulling the leash out of my hands. The reflective straps are most welcome when we walk in the evenings. Great product and speedy service in shipping! Kudos!
customer_reviews.author: Charles B.

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for the canine biatholon. They were helpful but a longer leash should be an option as a lot of the obstacles we had to detach from the belt so they could go over them without us. The piece for your thumb on the snap, that you push down to open the clip, broke during the biatholon. But we can still use it. We have been using the leashes for bite work training and they are really nice. Overall, it really helped with the biatholon and I will probably use them to train for the next biatholon and get me a new set before the actual race.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.text: The bungee leash is incredibly strong, to the point where my 55lb. pit is pulled back when he attempts to pull. As a result, he's much easier to re-direct. The belt is incredibly sturdy, and the clip is behind two metal rings, which means that the clip doesn't bear the brunt of his pulling. I used it this morning for umbilical training and he settled much faster than he usually does. The belt even has a ring for clipping a bag-holder to. I don't know why I didn't invest in this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: *Update* Was great before the latch broke
customer_reviews.text: We used this leash for a few weeks before one of the clips broke when our boxer tried to take off running. We are only able to use the lease portion of the set now as the body portion has the broken clip. *Update* I originally gave this product twould stars, but right away the seller contacted me to let me know they have refunded me and have sent another leash in hopes this was a factory defect with the clip that broke. I will update again after using this leash for a month. I am very impressed by the customer service and for this alone will look for more products from this seller. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Susandt10

customer_reviews.title: Comes Unsnapped Easily
customer_reviews.text: Okay product, disappointed in durability. The leash is not able to freely move 360° around the human so my dog still tangled me. Twice now I’ve had the belt come unsnapped when my 80 pound dog stopped in his tracks and I kept walking. Can’t imagine what would happen if he was actually pulling. The belt itself is quite rough and uncomfortable, I find that it digs into my hip bones no matter where I place it. Overall it’s nice to be hands-free but I am disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Lefebvre

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought two and both are broken, both the same way in about two weeks. My dog is a puppy, GSD/AH, just 7 months old. First the Velcro which attaches the handle to the leach wouldn't attach anymore. Second the bungee cord broke inside, so there is no stretch at all anymore. And last but not least: the handle broke. Just ripped off. Don't waste your money on them.
customer_reviews.author: Adirana

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, I use it every time I go out running. I find it really durable and the leash part is stretchy so if my dog stops while I'm running she quickly joins me. I don't recommend it for walking if you have a stronger dog as my dog can easily pull me when I don't have a lot of momentum (like I do while running). It's comfortable to wear and I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Fcan21

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product so far
customer_reviews.text: I've only been on one 3.5 mile run with my pup (37 pound mix of unknown lineage), but this product worked great! So nice to be running hands free! The bungee function is awesome at letting her feel some tension, but not pulling me forward with her. She's very social, so every other dog we came across she made a b-line for, otherwise I was actually a little amazed at how well things went. My dog will need a little more training, but we'll get there.
customer_reviews.author: Balasilk

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: First of all, hands free is the way to go when shopping for a leash, but this one can go either way. Great quality and looks just as pictured. I just used this leash constantly all week to keep my dog by my side while we were camping. I could drink/grill/eat ice cream/putt putt golf freely without losing a hand to the leash. I have a border collie puppy who's only 30 pounds, but if she bolts towards something the leash does absorb most of the shock. Only complaint would be the metal clasps got really scratched up pretty fast, but no effect on the use of the product. All around happy with this purchase and use it often.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Boseck

customer_reviews.title: excellent but wrong dog
customer_reviews.text: I actually think it's well made, is sturdy, and holds up to a shepherd dog tugging on it. Being hands free is great. But unfortunately, if your dog tugs really hard to get to things they shouldn't, it isn't great because of how flexible it is, and you probably want more control without the bungee portion of the leash. So full marks for a nice leash, I just can't use it.
customer_reviews.author: Cee

customer_reviews.title: Great Leash
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made product. I love it because it gives me the wonderful option of hands free walking the dog...especially if it's raining and I want to hold an umbrella or in the dark holding flashlight. It is easy to hook up and the extra stretchiness gives stability if the dogs pulls unexpectedly. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend buying this leash and its a really reasonable price too!!!
customer_reviews.author: SLW

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hands free leash!!!
customer_reviews.text: So I walk other people's dogs and also have a Boxador pup. I love this leash for hikes/walks/runs it has two handles and it has one of the most comfortable belts!!! I have tried other hands free leashes and they always hurt my back. Not this one!!! Sorry SparklyPets for pronouncing your name incorrectly in my review video.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but Not sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: At first I was so in love with this leash because my dog is so vigorous he hurted my arm twice.... but then, after four days of use, the zipper end was broke so I had to re stitch it. Then after three or four months of daily use, the spring of the leash thorn from one end, so now I have one long not tight leash. The system is very good though, the belt incredibly comfortable. I would love to get another one but I am afraid it would broke again.
customer_reviews.author: Diacor79

customer_reviews.title: Best security loops!!
customer_reviews.text: The best leash ever if you don’t want to lose your dog!!! I got this for my 7 year old so he can walk pup worry free. It’s got the best nickel because this is the only one I found that has a latch OVER the belt buckle on either side for max security. Even our dog trainer was impressed and asked for the product name and where to find it!!! She was look g for one to run with! My son’s waist is smaller than the smallest belt size but it’s fine over his winter coat. If in doubt for a child I’d say get it anyway, maybe you can loop part of the belt thru jeans!
customer_reviews.author: TeachnycMom

customer_reviews.title: Great hands free leash
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for use inorder to be able to walk my dog after having shoulder surgery. It has worked out perfectly and I haven't had any problems with the leash. My only small complaint is that waist part tends to loosen up while in use. If there was a way to better lock the size of the waist band it would be even better.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan O

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!! The PERFECT LEASH!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a disabled veteran with mobility issues, and this is the PERFECT LEASH!!!! I have a service dog and this works perfect for me to use while in my wheelchair and still give my dog ample room to maneuver. Also this would be perfect for anyone who has a large dog to walk as this is at your waist and would definitely give a person more stability PLUS you have both hands available to use! I highly recommend this product to EVERYONE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Talo Running-Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Amazing leash!
customer_reviews.text: This hands free leash is great. I am recovering from hand surgery and this leash allows me to walk our dog, without worry of her damaging my hand. I like the extra d ring on the belt to clip a bag dispenser. The handles on the leash make it easy to reel her in close when crossing the street. No complaints about this leash whatsoever!
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: This is honestly so perfect. I take her everywhere with my bike
customer_reviews.text: I got into a motorcycle accident and had an open fracture in my ankle. I can no longer run, but my Husky can, and she needs to! So, I needed something to keep her leashed while I ride my bike beside her. This is honestly so perfect. I take her everywhere with my bike, just riding up and down the street in the neighborhood. If we go to a crowded beach area where the boardwalk is packed, I can make the leash shorter by using clipping it to the extra ring. It's very durable and strong, and the elastic part works great.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!!!
customer_reviews.text: It works great with my Labrador Retriever as we run together - it’s awesome!! I absolutely love it!! He’s 75/lbs and I ordered the large however I have a 17 lb Rat terrier and ran with her as well separately and it worked great for her too - the leash is just a regular leash and can fit any collar or harness and the belt for me if adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Kiawahgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasts... *Updated*
customer_reviews.text: I really loved the leash at first, which is why I gave it two stars instead of one. Unfortunately, the bungee snapped inside during our last camping trip (thankfully I brought a backup leash). It only lasted two months.... **Update: This company has amazing customer service. They sent me a brand new leash and I received it in one day. I hope this one holds up because it is a great leash.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: This is so great to use
customer_reviews.text: This is so great to use. It can be adjusted to your waist from small to large. My youngest teenage son loves using this with our lab/husky pup, they are both runners so it works out great. He has the control of the leash if needed, but it also doesn't kill his hands if she stops short, the bungee on the leash is great. I had concerns about other leashes that you could connect the bungee to the regular leash as an extension, but this one solved that because it's all in one. Thank you so much. The shipping was fast!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for running with your dog!
customer_reviews.text: I started getting into running with my dog and I was annoyed with the fact that I had to hold on to his leash while I ran, and even then he would stray away and I would accidentally yank on his leash pretty hard. This has been an absolute game changer...exactly what I was looking for. The actual leash part of it is pretty short, but I personally like that because I don't have to worry about pulling my pup in for passing bikes. I even started using this when I'm just walking him around just because it's nice to have two free hands. Great Quality. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Janssen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for jogging with my dog!
customer_reviews.text: My chiropractor said that holding a dog leash in my left hand while jogging was messing up my back and hips because I wasn’t moving my arm much and didn’t have proper opposition. So I bought this hands free leash hoping it would help...OMG, why didn’t I get this earlier!! I love this leash. It is adjustable to any size and is super comfortable while running. I still have a lot of control over my 130lb Rottweiler. I am looking forward to bringing my dog fishing and not worrying about him wondering off! Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Ceder

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is effortless, makes running and walking my 6-month old lab easy. Thank you to the creators for making a belt/bungee cord/leash. UPDATE: My lab is 9 months old and two weeks ago I woke up to a leash that had somehow lost its elasticity, it's just a normal rope now and is way too long for our runs/walks.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Really good product and well built
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because of design. When used with my "large" breed dog, the strap that goes around the body is so thin it hurts from the pulling of your dog. As for the product itself, it's very well built and well worth the price. Hopefully, my review gets noticed and the designers will cut the design to make the part that goes around the body WIDER.
customer_reviews.author: est8esq

customer_reviews.title: The belt is comfortable and easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: I have a 26 lb Jack Russel/Pointer mix puppy. Full of energy and when he locks onto a squirrel or rabbit he doesn't hesitate to try and take off after them. The bungy effect in this leash takes the shock of unexpected pulls. The belt is comfortable and easy to adjust. Length is perfect to give my pup enough lead and out of my way, but not too long to allow him to get tangled. My favorite feature: the lead line easily slides around the waist belt for times when my puppy decides to move from one side to the other.
customer_reviews.author: renee

customer_reviews.title: Bungee broke
customer_reviews.text: With the amount of great reviews I decided to buy this leash, the idea is great & priced right. Unfortunately I should've listened to the bad reviews. After about a week & 1/2 the bungee broke leaving me with a standard leash. If I wanted a standard leash I would've bought one. I guess the more expensive Kong is going to be the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Bagman

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: We added a pitsky (pit x husky) to our clan of 2 humans and 2 adult dogs. The new puppy is out of control at times - as all puppies will be - so we have needed to attach him to us as an umbilical cord for occasional control. This leash and belt have made this SO EASY and have helped make training a breeze - as much as crazy puppy training can be a breeze. Also good for walks, but we got it more for in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Star Fire

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking our 120 pound dog
customer_reviews.text: My husband was looking for something to wrap around his waist while walking our Great Pyrenees. After reading tons of reviews I decided to go with this product. My husband was happy with the product; work as described. Even with it being a good length, my husband wished it was a little longer or had other different connect areas to adjust the length.
customer_reviews.author: Torie

customer_reviews.title: Great for Labs!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my SparklyPets hands free leash! I walk with my lab every morning. She and I love to run intervals and using a regular leash was getting dangerous...she runs faster than me. Anyway, I love how it is streamlined and non-bulky under my fitted winter jacket. The movable loops are great to hold my poop bags too. The best part is my shoulders are not being taxed by her pulling on the leash any longer. The bungee is nice and strong so it takes alot of effort for her to extend it. The price was excellent too. Thanks for creating such a sturdy, useful product!
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but was evident have been used/returned.
customer_reviews.text: Great hands free dog leash, especially when walking multiple dogs. Only issue is that the item had been used/returned (hair on product). It was out of original packaging, and even had packing tape to keep it in the storage bag, that left tape reside on the outside of the bag. I would have returned, if didn’t need for immediate use.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Best Leash Ever - very vesatile
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipment -- great product! My son requires a service dog; the handle down lower is awesome for handling. I also love the two clips on either end, as we use one as a seatbelt restraint (clips into the carseat mechanism of a car) and then it clips to his service vest harness. Best leash ever -- thank you!
customer_reviews.author: JorP

product_meta.title: SparklyPets Hands-Free Dog Leash for Medium and Large Dogs – Professional Harness with Reflective Stitches for Training, Walking, Jogging and Running Your Pet
feature_bullets: ★ SECURITY CLIPS ON THE BELT - Unlike other hands free leashes which can have your dog break free as a result of the belt unlatching, our professional leash has a support mechanism that is designed with 2 stainless steel clasps that take all the tension off the plastic buckle and divide the pulling force to both sides of the belt!

★ MADE FOR MEDIUM AND LARGE DOGS -If you have a large dog, you need a leash that absorbs shocks and allows you to control it without breaking stride. Provided with a strong, yet flexible bungee, and stainless steel clips, this hands-free dog leash is perfect for you!

★ PERFECT CONTROL - Being able to fully control your dog may be crucial, especially when crossing a busy street. The easy grip control handle on the bungee will allow you a firm, yet smooth hold on your dog whenever you need to keep it out of harm's way!

★ HANDS-FREE OR HANDS-ON- Whether you prefer a hands-free leash or a traditional one, we've got you covered. Provided with a convenient rubber handle, our professional leash can be switched from hands-free to hands-on in a matter of seconds!

★ MONEY BACK GUARANTEE-We're so confident in the quality of our Hands-Free Dog Leash that we give you a 100% satisfaction guarantee. In the unlikely event that our professional leash is not right for your pet, just send it back, and we'll promptly refund your money!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
